title-group.article-title: A Generalized Discrepancy and Quadrature Error Bound

abstract.p: An error bound for multidimensional quadrature is derived that includes the Koksma-Hlawka inequality as a special case. This error bound takes the form of a product of two terms. One term, which depends only on the integrand, is defined as a generalized variation. The other term, which depends only on the quadrature rule, is defined as a generalized discrepancy. The generalized discrepancy is a figure of merit for quadrature rules and includes as special cases the L<sup>p</sup>-star discrepancy and P<sub>Î±</sub> that arises in the study of lattice rules.
